tentpoles.title: The Impossible Data
tentpoles.description: Elliot decodes Voyager 2 signal containing mathematical proofs discovered by humanity in 2045. He runs the numbers obsessively - data is valid but shouldn't exist. Remembers his father's determinism lectures. Feels sick realization: bootstrap paradox is real.

tentpoles.title: The Recursionists
tentpoles.description: Dr. Soren's cult finds Elliot. They've been tracking the signal for years, built theology around it. Show him their calculations: he's the 'Closer' - the person whose actions in 2032 will complete the loop by ensuring signal is embedded in Voyager at 1977 launch. He thinks they're insane.

tentpoles.title: First Temporal Bleed
tentpoles.description: Elliot experiences vivid 'memory' of being shot in an alley - but he's never been shot. Cassandra identifies it as temporal displacement - he's remembering a timeline that hasn't happened yet (or already failed). Signal is causing his consciousness to bleed across loop iterations.

tentpoles.title: Agent Reyes Closes In
tentpoles.description: Government raid on SETI. Reyes interrogates Elliot about signal. She knows about temporal tech - her division has been preparing. Elliot realizes government wants to weaponize future knowledge. Escapes with Soren's help. Now fugitive.

tentpoles.title: Building the Device
tentpoles.description: Signal contains blueprints. Cassandra helps Elliot build quantum temporal interface. When activated, he sees timeline echoes - failed loops where different choices led to extinction. Sees himself die dozens of ways. Last layer of signal unlocks: personal message from his future self. 'This is the last loop. Close it right.'

tentpoles.title: Living in Echoes
tentpoles.description: Device allows Elliot to perceive probability waves across timelines. He's now living multiple moments simultaneously - talking to Cassandra while also experiencing timeline where she died. Fragmenting. Struggling to stay in 'correct' timeline.

tentpoles.title: The Weaponization Timeline
tentpoles.description: Elliot accesses timeline echo where government used temporal tech militarily. Nuclear war 2034. 8 billion dead. That timeline's Elliot tried to prevent it, failed, sent warning back. Our Elliot realizes every choice he makes could branch toward that outcome.

tentpoles.title: The Original Timeline
tentpoles.description: Through device, contacts dying humanity from original timeline (2150). No time travel, no bootstrap. Voyager was destroyed by debris, humanity never achieved interstellar travel, dying from climate collapse. They built quantum transmitter with last resources, sent one signal back to create bootstrap paradox. Elliot is living in timeline that shouldn't exist - a gift from the dead.

tentpoles.title: Reyes' Trauma Revealed
tentpoles.description: Agent Reyes captures Elliot. Under interrogation, she breaks - tells him about partner erased from timeline. Government experiment went wrong. She's the only one who remembers. Elliot uses device, finds timeline where partner existed. Shows her. She lets him go - uneasy alliance.

tentpoles.title: Meeting Omega
tentpoles.description: Elliot meets his future self - Elliot Omega, the iteration who has lived this loop approaching infinite times. Omega is barely human anymore, consciousness spread across temporal probability. Tells him: loop is destabilizing. This is final iteration. Elliot must go back to 1977, embed signal in Voyager, close the causal loop forever. Or timeline collapses, humanity never existed at all.

tentpoles.title: Temporal Pressure
tentpoles.description: Timeline degradation accelerates. Causality violations multiply - objects appearing before manufactured, people remembering events differently, déjà vu worldwide. Reality fighting the paradox. Elliot has weeks before total collapse. Must complete mission.

tentpoles.title: Soren's Sacrifice
tentpoles.description: Government faction tries to seize device to weaponize. Soren and Recursionists defend Elliot - final stand. Soren dies telling Elliot 'Your choice makes determinism sacred.' Elliot now has device and knowledge, but hunted by military.

tentpoles.title: The Burden of Choice
tentpoles.description: Cassandra decodes final layer of signal. Reveals truth: Elliot doesn't have to close the loop. He can let it collapse. Original timeline humanity is already dead - bootstrap timeline is bonus. But letting it collapse erases everyone he knows from existence. Choice: preserve bootstrap timeline (trapping humanity in loop forever) or free them to nonexistence.

tentpoles.title: Journey to 1977
tentpoles.description: Device fully activated. Elliot's consciousness travels back to August 1977, month before Voyager launch. Can only interact with timeline through quantum probability - must subtly influence engineers to embed signal. Discovers someone already there: Omega, ensuring it happens. They work together across time.

tentpoles.title: The Loop Closes
tentpoles.description: Elliot completes the embedding. Signal is now in Voyager, will be discovered in 2029, creating loop. But adds one change: hidden final layer only he can decode. Message to himself: 'You had a choice. You chose to preserve what matters.' Returns to 2032. Timeline stabilizes. Reunites with Cassandra. Bootstrap paradox complete. Humanity lives in loop, but loop was chosen - that makes it free will. Elliot Omega fades as loop closes - no longer needed. Elliot keeps the device, just in case.
